id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#configuration-variables)*

baud_rate.docs:
**int**: The baud rate to use for the serial UART port. Defaults to `115200`. Set to `0` to disable logging via UART.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#configuration-variables)*

tx_buffer_size.docs:
**int**: The size of the buffer used for log messages. Decrease this if you’re having memory problems. Defaults to `512`.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#configuration-variables)*

deassert_rts_dtr.docs:
**boolean**: Causes ESPHome to sequentially drive DTR and RTS false after opening a serial logging connection. Defaults to `false`. Many ESP boards use these signals to reset the chip or enter bootloader mode, and the effect of setting this option will be to reset the chip in application mode after opening the serial port, thus ensuring that all log messages from the boot process are captured. Note: Deassert typically means a TTL high level level since RTS/DTR are usually low active signals.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#configuration-variables)*

hardware_uart.docs:
**string**: The Hardware UART to use for logging. The default varies depending on the specific processor/chip and framework you are using. See the [table below](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-default-hardware-interfaces).

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#configuration-variables)*

level.docs:
**string**: The global log level. Any log message with a lower severity will not be shown. Defaults to `DEBUG`.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#configuration-variables)*

logs.docs:
**mapping**: Manually set the log level for a specific component or tag. See [Manual Log Levels for more information](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-manual-tag-specific-levels).

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#configuration-variables)*

initial_level.docs:
**string**: The initial log level, which may be varied at run time. Defaults to the same value as `level`.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#configuration-variables)*

on_message.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An action to be performed when a message is to be logged. The variables `int level`, `const char* tag` and `const char* message` are available for lambda processing.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#configuration-variables)*

esp8266_store_log_strings_in_flash.docs:
**boolean**: If set to false, disables storing log strings in the flash section of the device (uses more memory). Defaults to true.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#configuration-variables)*

format.docs:
**string**: The format for the message in [printf-style](https://esphome.io/components/display/index.html#display-printf).

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-log-action)*

args.docs:
**list of [lambda](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-lambda)**: The optional arguments for the format message.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-log-action)*

level.docs:
**string**: The [log level](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-log-levels) to print the message with. Defaults to `DEBUG`.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-log-action)*

tag.docs:
**string**: The tag (seen in front of the message in the logs) to print the message with. Defaults to `main`.

*See also: [Logger Component](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-log-action)*

log.docs:
Print a formatted message to the logs.

*See also: [`logger.log` Action](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-log-action)*

set_level.docs:
Set the log level at runtime. The level can only be set to a level that is no less severe than the global log level.

*See also: [`logger.set_level` Action](https://esphome.io/components/logger.html#logger-set-level-action)*
